create.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to make something exist that did not exist before
create.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Some people believe the universe was created by a big explosion.
Her behaviour is creating a lot of problems.
The new factory is expected to create more than 400 new jobs.
create.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: This dish was created by our chef Jean Richard.
Philip Glass created a new kind of music.
The software makes it easy to create colourful graphs.
create.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to make something exist that did not exist before
create.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The building boom has created 50,000 construction jobs in the state.
The two organizations will create a company to sell life insurance in Spain, with each providing 50% of the capital.
Central banks can create money by getting private banks to lend more.
Tourism creates wealth for the country.
create.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The design agency has created a number of American Express ads.
The technology can be used to create new products.
